        "page_1": "<Bold>1. ORIGINS</Bold>\n\nThe creature with the identifier 008 is a refurbished military-grade robot.         "page_2": "<Bold>2. SPECIMEN DISCOVERY</Bold>\n\nThe number of robots gradually declined, and this model has now been largely replaced. During the operation, Elisabeth Weaver left, leaving Dr. Miller alone with the subject. When she returned, the robot was leaning over her colleague‚Äôs body, removing its drill bit from his skull. The robot turned toward her with hostile behavior. Dr. Weaver immediately called the guard stationed at the laboratory entrance.\n\n<Italic>‚ÄúAt the sight of Sergeant McDowell, the robot immediately changed its behavior. It retracted its drill bit and assumed a pacifist attitude.‚Äù</Italic>",
        "page_3": "<Bold>3. THE ESCAPE</Bold>\n\nFollowing this accident, the subject was locked in a glass cell adjacent to Dr. Weaver‚Äôs office pending further examination. The ship‚Äôs passengers initially did not take this statement seriously.\n\nThanks to the ventilation system, the robot was able to move freely from target to target. Numerous victims were found in the restrooms and showers, and anywhere else passengers sought privacy. The ship‚Äôs population decreased by 53% in 24 hours. Following this massacre and the inability to neutralize the robot, the command center decided to head to the nearest port to evacuate the ship.",

CONCLUSION</Bold>\n\n<Underline>Suspected behavior of specimen ID_008</Underline>\n\nWe assume that the subject was corrupted during its reconditioning by the Bio Space Group. It then adopts a pacifist attitude, while following this group.\n\n‚Ä¢ The subject mistakes isolated humans for its research subjects (minerals or plants).
